page.title: 11Our Church.
page.content: The parishes of Carsington,Wirksworth, Alderwasley,Idridgehay,Kirk Ireton,and Middleton are now held in plurality and in 1984 the Rev'd.R.Caney became the first Rector of this United Benefice. He is assisted by the Rev'd. R.Smith as Curate and two Lay Readers Rod and Pauline Higham. Despite the various changes,attendance has not varied greatly over the last three decades, the normal congregation being an average of 14. Recently, the practice of processing round the village, on the morning of Rogation Sunday, has been revived quite successfully.The ever popular Harvest Festival,with Church decorated, is held at the beginning of October. The local school celebrates in church the following morning.The Christmas Day Communion service is usually attended by a congregation of 25-30 worshippers
